content: cab�� soc�� s�ay kni�� 1 cable socks small cables create a cozy fitting sock toe up construction with a mitered heel cables add a small enough detail to add interest without a complicated pattern this is a great pattern for beginners of socks or cables size average adult woman s 8 5 21 6 cm foot circumference with 5 1 27 cm negative ease for knitted sock materials fingering weight yarn approximately 50-70 grams 231-323 yards size 1 2 5 mm dpns or circular needles for magic loop stitch markers tapestry needle gauge 32 st x 42 row = 4 x 4 10 16 x 10 16 cm stockinette adjust needle size to obtain gauge or increase needle size for larger foot circumference decrease needle size for smaller foot circumference abbreviations k = knit w&t = wrap and turn p = purl c4f = move next 2 stitches to m1l = make 1 left cable needle and hold in front m1r = make 1 right knit next 2 stitches on needle in st = stitch left hand move 2 on cable pm = place marker needle back to needle in left k2tog = knit 2 together hand knit 2 s�ay kni�� 2 pattern toe using a figure 8 cast on cast on a total of 20 stitches 10 on front needle 10 on back needle mark beginning of round as first 10 stitches will be the instep and the last 10 stitches will be the bottom of the foot 20 sts k1 m1l k to last stitch of instep m1r k1 k1 m1l k to last stitch of bottom of foot m1r k1 repeat this round 3 times 4 st increase per round 32 sts total begin increase rounds as follows round 1 - k1 m1l k to last stitch of instep m1r k1 k1 m1l k to last stitch of bottom of foot m1r k1 4 st increase per round 1 round 2 - k around continue knitting round 1 then round 2 until you have 64 total stitches on the needles foot cable pattern round 1-6 p2 k4 p2 4 times k to end round 7 p2 c4f p2 4 times work these 7 row of cable pattern until work measures 2 5 cm from back of heel take note of which row of the pattern you have completed s�ay kni�� 3 heel work pattern across instep stitches then k to last stitch across bottom of foot stitches w&t last stitch p to last stitch on bottom of foot stitches w&t last stitch k to 1 stitch before wrapped stitch w&t p to 1 stitch before wrapped stitch w&t continue in this manner until there are 10 stitches left between the wrapped stitches ending on a p row k across 10 stitches left unwrapped pick up wrap and k together with stitch w&t p across to first wrapped stitch pick up wrap and p together with stitch w&t k to double wrapped stitch pick up both wraps and
